definition: to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess
to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to

sentences.english: You have one where you have almost only pirates in there.
sentences.chinese: 有一家只招待海盜的酒吧。

sentences.english: After the waitress arrived with our food, we ate in silence for a time.
sentences.chinese: 女招待端來了我們的晚餐，我們默默地吃了一會兒。

sentences.english: According to the salon's manager, Miyuki Gunji, 90 percent of their clientele are hostesses.
sentences.chinese: 該沙龍經理稱，他們客戶中的90%都是女招待。

sentences.english: The usher insisted on reseating us.
sentences.chinese: 這名招待員堅持給我們領位。

sentences.english: He likes excercise, and takes me to girls' clubs.
sentences.chinese: 喜歡運動，帶我去招待女賓俱樂部。

sentences.english: I'm afraid you're not quite right.
sentences.chinese: 我恐怕招待得很不周到。

sentences.english: He is lunching me well at the Friday Hotel.
sentences.chinese: 他在星期五飯店招待我喫豐盛的午餐。

sentences.english: You are cordially invited to a reception to be given in our ministry on Saturday evening.
sentences.chinese: 誠懇邀請參加我部本星期六晚間舉行的招待會。

sentences.english: My days of roughing it in hostels or fleabag motels are over.
sentences.chinese: 在招待所和廉價汽車旅館度假的日子已經過去了。

sentences.english: I finished my sandwich, and the waitress cleared our plates.
sentences.chinese: 我喫完了自己的三文治，女招待收走了桌上的餐碟。
您的殷勤招待，我將永記在心。

sentences.english: He's not very attentive to his guest.
sentences.chinese: 他對客人的招待不很周到。

sentences.english: She managed to wangle an invitation to the reception.
sentences.chinese: 她設法弄到了招待會的請帖。

sentences.english: The press conference ended up in a slanging match , each side shouting at the other.
sentences.chinese: 記者招待會最後變成謾罵比賽，雙方相對咆哮。

sentences.english: An usher stood at the door giving out programs.
sentences.chinese: 招待員站在門口發表節目表。

sentences.english: A waitress working at the Harrahs in New Orleans.
sentences.chinese: 在新奧爾良哈蘭工作的女招待。

definition: to entertain (for dinner)/to invite to dinner
to receive (a visitor)/to admit (allow sb to enter)
to hold a welcoming dinner or reception
to give a dinner party/to entertain guests/to invite to dinner
to act as host/to do the honors
food and drink/food to accompany wine
hospitality/to treat guests well/to enjoy having guests/hospitable/friendly
